description.narrative: The Program Development Objective of the DPL series is to support the Guatemalan Government in creating fiscal space and expanding opportunities for the most vulnerable segments of society.

title.narrative: Increase in tax collections as a share of GDP

comment.narrative: Annual cumulative tax collections in 2012 were 10.85 percent of 2012 GDP. Only a small part of the 2012 tax reforms was effectivein 2012; an income tax reform became effective in January 2013. A fall in import values led to a weak performance in import tariffsand import-related VAT collections. Cumulative tax collections between January-April 2013 were 3.83 percent of the projected GDPfor 2013. (Source: SAT). Annual cumulative tax collection for 2013 is estimated at around 11.4 percent of GDP.

title.narrative: Tax information is exchanged with other countries as twelve tax information sharing agreements have been signed

comment.narrative: In addition to the seven agreements already signed, a draft TIEA has been agreed upon with Australia, but its signature is pendingprocedural steps to be taken by the Australian Government. In 2012 Guatemala signed the Agreement on Mutual Assistance andTechnicalCooperation between the Tax and Customs Administrations in Central America (equivalent to an additional 4 TIEAs). Inaddition, in December 2012 the Guatemalan government signed the OECD Multilateral Convention on Mutual Administrative Assistance inTax Matters. This now allows Guatemala to exchange tax information with 45 countries including including with the USA and Mexico.The OECD has moved Guatemala from the "gray list" to the list of countries that have made substantial progress in terms oftransparency in tax matters. (Source: SAT.)

title.narrative: Number of Zero Hunger offices established in priority municipalities with the highest incidence of chronic malnutrition

comment.narrative: The Government has at least one representative of the Zero Hunger Program in 151 municipalities in Guatemala. A malnutritionsurvey was completed in cooperation with the National Institute of Statistics. A baseline for the monitoring of the program wasestablished.

title.narrative: Increase in the number of audits of exports and imports

comment.narrative: In 2012 the total number of audits of exports and imports was 452. In addition, in 2012 there were a total of 837 verifications(joint operatives) for imports and exports. (Source: SAT).

title.narrative: CES holds regular meetings to discuss public policies

comment.narrative: CES held 6 assemblies in 2012 and is scheduled to hold 24 assemblies in 2013. Two commissions have been created inside the CES(Rural Development, and Employment). CES also produced in 2013 an annual report on the economic and social context in Guatemala.(Source: CES).

title.narrative: Major social programs are included in the Unique Beneficiary Registry

comment.narrative: Advances have been made with regards to MIDES' institutional structure, with the appointment of two vice ministers (socialprotection; policy, planning and evaluation). A Unique Beneficiary Registry is being set up and will include major social programs.

title.narrative: Percentage of children under 1 year old in 83 prioritized municipalities who receive the appropriate growth promotion package of services for their age

comment.narrative: The Government has defined a list of indicators in line with the results-based management agreement, and has taken steps to set upa monitoring an evaluation framework for priority health programs. A database to measure the percentage of children who receiveappropriate growth promotion packages is being prepared but is not yet operational. An updated value for this indicators is not yetavailable.

title.narrative: Percentage of women in 83 prioritized municipalities who are attended to during labor in facilities of the Ministry of Public Health and Social Assistance by qualified providers

comment.narrative: The Government has defined a list of indicators in line with the results-based management agreement, and has taken steps to set upa monitoring an evaluation framework for priority health programs. A database to measure the percentage of women who are attendedduring labor by qualified providers is being prepared but is not yet operational. An updated value for this indicators is not yetavailable.

title.narrative: Increase in the tax base by 8 percent

comment.narrative: The tax base - defined as the number of taxpayers paying any taxes to SAT (i.e., effective tax payers and tax payers subject toretention) increased from 1.8 million in 2011 to 1.95 million in 2012. In 2012 the SAT updated the tax base, including eliminatingduplicates in the tax payers database. (Source: SAT.)
